```{r setup, include=TRUE}
library(tidyverse)

```
## Read in data

I am going to first read in the State County data set. This shows a breakdown of State and County Railroad Employment

```{r , message=FALSE}
StateCounty<-readxl::read_excel("_data/StateCounty2012.xls", skip=3) %>%
  select(STATE,COUNTY,TOTAL)%>%
  filter(!str_detect(("STATE"),"(County)"))%>%
  arrange(StateCounty,"(TOTAL)")
  
```
### I will now finish by using the summarise function

```{r , message=FALSE}
StateCounty %>%
    group_by(COUNTY) %>%
    summarise_each(funs(min(., na.rm=TRUE), max(., na.rm=TRUE)), matches("TOTAL"))
```
